title: Energy transfer for melting of ice

content.question: A <math alttext="1.5 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> sample of ice, <math alttext="H 2 O, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, at <math alttext="0.0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is placed in a warm room. Which of the following best describes the energy transfer involved in melting the ice to create liquid water at <math alttext="0.0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>? (The heat of fusion of <math alttext="H 2 O, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is <math alttext="334 joules per gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>334</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math>.)

choices.label: <math alttext="334" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>334</mn></math> joules of energy is transferred from the ice to the room.
<math alttext="334" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>334</mn></math> joules of energy is transferred from the room to the ice.
<math alttext="501" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>501</mn></math> joules of energy is transferred from the ice to the room.
<math alttext="501" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>501</mn></math> joules of energy is transferred from the room to the ice.

content.answer: <math alttext="501" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>501</mn></math> joules of energy is transferred from the room to the ice.
